articles.author: STEPHANY MATAT, ERIC TUCKER, TERRY SPENCER, ALANNA DURKIN RICHER and COLLEEN LONG
articles.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — The man suspected in an apparent assassination attempt targeting Donald Trump camped outside a Florida golf course with food and a rifle for nearly 12 hours, lying in wait for the former president before a Secret Service agent thwarted the potential attack and opened fire, according to court documents filed Monday.
articles.title: Suspect in apparent assassination attempt on Trump was near golf course for 12 hours, records show

articles.author: MICHAEL BIESECKER, AUDREY McAVOY, BERNARD CONDON and MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: KAAAWA, Hawaii (AP) — Ryan Wesley Routh portrayed himself online as a man who built housing for homeless people in Hawaii, tried to recruit fighters for Ukraine to defend itself against Russia, and described his support and then disdain for Donald Trump — even urging Iran to kill him.
articles.title: Man who appeared intent on killing Trump wrote a book urging Iran to assassinate the ex-president

articles.author: JOSEF FEDERMAN and JULIA FRANKEL
articles.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — Israel said Tuesday that halting Hezbollah's attacks in the country's north to allow residents to return to their homes is now an official war goal, as it considers a wider military operation in Lebanon that could ignite an all-out conflict.
articles.title: Israel says halting Hezbollah attacks is now a war goal as officials warn of a wider operation

articles.author: LARRY NEUMEISTER and MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Sean “Diddy" Combs was expected to appear before a federal judge in New York on Tuesday after his indictment on undisclosed criminal charges.
articles.title: Sean 'Diddy' Combs is expected in court after New York indictment

articles.author: ALI SWENSON
articles.description: NEW YORK (AP) — Hours after an apparent attempt on Donald Trump's life over the weekend, Elon Musk took to his social platform X to post a thinking emoji and a comment that “no one is even trying to assassinate” the Democratic president and vice president.
articles.title: Elon Musk has often inflamed politically tense moments, raising worries for the US election

articles.author: KELVIN CHAN
articles.description: LONDON (AP) — Meta said it's banning Russia state media organization from its social media platforms, alleging that the outlets used deceptive tactics to amplify Moscow's propaganda. The announcement drew a rebuke from the Kremlin on Tuesday.
articles.title: Facebook owner Meta bans Russia state media outlets over "foreign interference"

articles.description: BANGKOK (AP) — Floods and landslides in Myanmar triggered by last week’s Typhoon Yagi and seasonal monsoon rains have claimed at least 226 lives, with 77 people missing, state-run media reported Tuesday.
articles.title: Casualties in Myanmar push Southeast Asia's death toll from Typhoon Yagi past 500

articles.author: DIANE JEANTET
articles.description: AVIGNON, France (AP) — A 71-year-old French man acknowledged in court Tuesday that he drugged his then-wife and invited dozens of men to rape her over nearly a decade, as well as raping her himself.
articles.title: A French man admits in court to drugging his wife so that he and dozens of men could rape her

articles.author: JUAN A. LOZANO
articles.description: DEER PARK, Texas (AP) — A towering flame gradually subsided Tuesday morning in the aftermath of a massive pipeline explosion after a vehicle drove through a fence and struck an above-ground valve, officials said.
articles.title: Massive pipeline fire burning near Houston began after a vehicle struck a valve, officials say

articles.author: PATRICK WHITTLE
articles.description: A key employee who labeled an experimental submersible unsafe prior to its last, fatal voyage was set to testify Tuesday before U.S.
articles.title: A key employee who called the Titan unsafe will testify before the Coast Guard
